tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The reason for man’s being misguided in respect of God is that, although he accepts His existence, he often frames a wrong image of God in his mind. Looking at Kings, he assumes the existence of deputies and assistants of God, just as there are regents and advisers of Kings
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: He informs people of the Hereafter which, in heaven and on the earth, is equal in gravity to a full pregnancy in a woman’s womb. To call a missionary of God’s religion a madman is the greatest of all transgressions, because the message with which he comes is one which is corroborated by the entir...

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-A'raf, Ayah 185?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: As this world is a place of testing, Doomsday will be indicated here in terms of caution and warning alone. Only the sincere will believe in the Day of Judgement, without wanting to know the exact date of its occurrence

tafsirQuiz.question: What deeper meaning is explained in this verse?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: This perfect harmony could not be possible unless the Creator and Lord of this universe were one and in control of its functioning. In the universe countless items or parts are found separately; but all these parts combine and become a harmonious whole
distractors: This verse only discusses worldly matters

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: But how surprising it is that in this world, where there are so many arguments in favour of one God, man makes polytheism his religion. By this token, the worship of these manifestations amounts to the worship of the god whom they are supposed to represent

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-A'raf, Ayah 197?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: It is God alone who helps His servants in this world and it is He who will also help His faithful servants in the world to come. However, this is not restricted only to known types of idols

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Calling people to monotheism, the Hereafter, a virtuous life and justice is to call people to good (‘urf). In such a state of affairs when the call for pure Truth is given to them, they are afraid that their interests will be affected so they oppose it with all their might

tafsirQuiz.question: What is the main message of Surah Al-A'raf, Ayah 204?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: When man frees himself from arrogance, he is so engrossed with God’s marvels expressed in creation that he cannot but remember God always from the innermost recesses of his heart
distractors: This verse talks about the Day of Judgment only
